title: OS X 10.4: 8g: Undefined symbols: _yychar _p9main
body:
by **reivax**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.Follow directions from http://golang.org/doc/install.html
2.perform ./all.bash
3.

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
Expected:
--- cd ../test
N known bugs; 0 unexpected bugs

Actual:
%%%% making 8g %%%%
...
quietgcc -o 8g -L/Users/xavier/go/lib ../8l/enam.o list.o galign.o gobj.o
ggen.o gsubr.o cgen.o cgen64.o peep.o reg.o  ../gc/gc.ao -lbio -l9 -lm
/usr/bin/ld: Undefined symbols:
_yychar
_p9main
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
make: *** [8g] Error 1



What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?
Darwin 386 (OSX 10.4.11 Tiger)


Which revision are you sync'ed to?  (hg log -l 1)
changeset:   4080:e85473427678
tag:         tip
user:        Robert Griesemer <gri@golang.org>
date:        Mon Nov 16 17:53:39 2009 -0800
summary:     bug218.go: testcase for issue #238
This is the latest checkout.


Please provide any additional information below.
Preexisting issues solved:  https://golang.org/issue/149
I am aware this version of OSX is relatively old.
